thread.title: Fielding Alum Dr. Michael Sessions Promoted to Dean of The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering Brigham Young University – Idaho
thread.title_full: Fielding Alum Dr. Michael Sessions Promoted to Dean of The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering Brigham Young University – Idaho

author: Fielding News
title: Fielding Alum Dr. Michael Sessions Promoted to Dean of The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering Brigham Young University – Idaho
text:
Michael Sessions, Ph.D.
Fielding alumnus Dr. Michael Sessions was promoted to Dean of The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering Brigham Young University – Idaho. In 2023, Dr. Sessions was appointed Associate Dean of Curriculum at Brigham Young University – Idaho (BYU-Idaho). Prior to that, Dr. Sessions served as the department chair of design and construction management at BYU-Idaho, where he was instrumental in redesigning the construction management degree and leading the development of the virtual design and construction degree. In his capacity as the Dean of the College of Physical Sciences and Engineering, Dr. Sessions will lead the charge to enhance programs and improve student outcomes. His overarching goal is to assure that students receive a high-quality education that prepares them for successful careers in their respective fields. Dr. Sessions earned his Ph.D. in Human Development from Fielding Graduate University.
The Fielding degree in Human Development equipped me with valuable knowledge in leadership and learning theory. — Dr. Michael Sessions
The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering at Brigham Young University – Idaho annually enrolls over 6,000 students in disciplines such as Chemistry, Math, Geology, Physics, Engineering, Computer Sciences, Manufacturing Technologies, and Construction Management. The leadership team is dedicated to ensuring the success of its students and the strength of its programs, leading this team is the Dean of The College of Physical Sciences and Engineering .
Learn More About the Ph.D. in Human Development
